p.s: As I've read a lot of Shakespeare's sonnets and informed myself about his work and life, how he deals with the theme of love, time and beatury is incredible.
He has around 256 sonnets and 156 is about a man named fair youth, which is in love with the Dark Lady.
The way he explains this love in his sonnets and the way he uses his typical Shakespearean language to underline this feeling of ove, is really inspiring.
In addition to theme of love he wrote all his language but also because of the imagination of love he creates in his sonnet.
In his most famous sonnet, Sonnet 18 or Shall I compare thee to a summer's day he compares love with a summer's day.
Moreover, he tries to make the reader to imagine a summer's day and use his sense of smelling or seing in order to keep his poem alove everytime somebody reads it and to feel love.
I am truly inspired by his work, by his typical language, how he tells a story in his sonnets with his writing style.
And I'm truly sure that I'm not the only person, who he has inspired, because there are a lot of world's great artists that have been inspired by the Shakespearean lover.
